messages.message: @Heymian I think I’ll take you up on that offer of an overview of how ACLs work. We have a different client (c1) who just upgraded to our September release and now can’t see any orgs. (https://instabase.zendesk.com/agent/tickets/447 if you can view tickets in Zendesk). I’m pretty sure this is going to be ACL related…
@Handsome Dave @Heymian may i join the ACL overview too?

Responded with my best guess in chat to the ticket. Sounds like they might have been relying on site-admin powers to access all repos in all orgs, instead of actually adding the user to the org. This changed when we introduced the site setting to limit the powers of site admins, should have been in the release notes.
and yes, can definitely explain some acl stuff to y’all.

```
Hello Adam,

One of the changes between the June and September release was locking down whether or not a "site-admin" can view all orgs (and all of the repos within them). An environmental flag was added: `SITE_SETTING_SITE_ADMIN_CAN_ACCESS_ALL_ORGS`, defaulting to False, to control this behavior. This is what is preventing you from viewing the orgs the way you used to.

There are two different approaches to fix this for you:

1) You can set that value to True in the yamls and redeploy to get the old behavior (if you do so, please let us know so we can set it that way for you going forward). While more convenient, this allows all site admins to see all data that's processed by Instabase, regardless of group, which may not fit with your preferred internal security model.

2) You can add each user to each org as an admin, which will allow them to access all repos in that given org. While more secure by default, this is also more overhead.

For more information on what org admins can do, see https://instabase.com/docs/content/management/teams_and_orgs/orgs.html#org-admin-actions

Please let me know which course of action you take, so we can make sure to update our releases.

Thank you!

David
```

Does this look good? No lies?
Lgtm! Can you check if this value is actually False for them right now?
Yeah, I was the one that built the release for them, so I double-checked that first thing :slightly_smiling_face:
@Heymian I checked and `ENABLE_ORG_SUPPORT` is actually set to False for them. I’m assuming start there? (I don’t know why/how it was set to false, I’ll be looking into that as well)
